BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>🐛 Bug description</denchmark-h>
 
 Don't know if it's normal (because not yet stable feature) but using the following code :
 <denchmark-code>profiler = BasicTimeProfiler()
 profiler.attach(trainer)
 ...
 results = profiler.get_results()
 print(results)
 BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results())
 </denchmark-code>
 
 and I got a runtime error (I put here stack including print msg)
 <denchmark-code>OrderedDict([('processing_stats', OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.002581869950518012, 937)), ('max/index', (0.24407817423343658, 0)), ('mean', 0.005071939900517464), ('std', 0.005763144697993994), ('total', 9.514959335327148)])), ('dataflow_stats', OrderedDict([('min/index', (5.4130003263708204e-05, 1874)), ('max/index', (0.02181326039135456, 1875)), ('mean', 0.00013960782962385565), ('std', 0.0006590772536583245), ('total', 0.2619042992591858)])), ('event_handlers_stats', {'EPOCH_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (6.137001037131995e-06, 0)), ('max/index', (1.3475997548084706e-05, 1)), ('mean', 9.80649929260835e-06), ('std', 5.189453986531589e-06), ('total', 1.96129985852167e-05)]), 'EPOCH_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (3.951500654220581, 0)), ('max/index', (4.009259223937988, 1)), ('mean', 3.980380058288574), ('std', 0.0408414751291275), ('total', 7.960760116577148)]), 'STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (4.647001333069056e-06, 0)), ('max/index', (4.647001333069056e-06, 0)), ('mean', 4.647001333069056e-06), ('std', nan), ('total', 4.647001333069056e-06)]), 'COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.001252603018656373, 0)), ('max/index', (0.001252603018656373, 0)), ('mean', 0.001252603018656373), ('std', nan), ('total', 0.001252603018656373)]), 'ITERATION_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (1.2870004866272211e-06, 931)), ('max/index', (1.6206002328544855e-05, 784)), ('mean', 2.0810284695471637e-06), ('std', 1.0310620837117312e-06), ('total', 0.003904009470716119)]), 'ITERATION_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (0.00041244301246479154, 6)), ('max/index', (0.0033979369327425957, 1706)), ('mean', 0.0005990439676679671), ('std', 0.00017004708934109658), ('total', 1.1238064765930176)]), 'GET_BATCH_STARTED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (2.2699969122186303e-06, 1871)), ('max/index', (6.306700379354879e-05, 1627)), ('mean', 3.619041763158748e-06), ('std', 2.3099164536688477e-06), ('total', 0.006789322476834059)]), 'GET_BATCH_COMPLETED': OrderedDict([('min/index', (1.471998984925449e-06, 934)), ('max/index', (1.4063996786717325e-05, 918)), ('mean', 2.3078853246261133e-06), ('std', 8.762469292378228e-07), ('total', 0.0043295929208397865)]), 'total_time': tensor(9.1009)}), ('event_handlers_names', {'EPOCH_STARTED_names': ['Metric.started'], 'EPOCH_COMPLETED_names': ['ProgressBar._close', 'log_training_results_fn', 'log_validation_results_fn'], 'STARTED_names': ['BasicTimeProfiler._as_first_started'], 'COMPLETED_names': ['ModelCheckpoint'], 'ITERATION_STARTED_names': [], 'ITERATION_COMPLETED_names': ['Metric.iteration_completed', 'Metric.completed', 'LRScheduler', '_OutputHandler', 'Engine._handler_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper', 'Engine._handler_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper'], 'GET_BATCH_STARTED_names': [], 'GET_BATCH_COMPLETED_names': []})])
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "tutorials/mnist/mnist.py", line 228, in <module>
     BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results())
   File "/work/desrozis/Softwares/conda/envs/focus-light/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ignite/contrib/handlers/time_profilers.py", line 414, in print_results
     **others,
 KeyError: 'Events_STARTED'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 There is no key Events_STARTED and more generaly no one begins with the Events_ prefix. Did I miss something ? Or is it the output_message variable in the time_profilers.py file which is corrupted ?
 Thanks for your help !
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4
 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): master
 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux
 How you installed Ignite (conda, pip, source): pip from sources
 Python version: 3.7
 Any other relevant information: git tag 4dced08

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sdesrozis>@sdesrozis</denchmark-link>
  I can not reproduce your issue. Could you please provide a snippet to reproduce it.
 Here is mine
 import ignite
 print(ignite.__version__)
 
 from ignite.contrib.handlers.time_profilers import BasicTimeProfiler
 from ignite.engine import Engine
 
 
 trainer = Engine(lambda e, b: None)
 profiler = BasicTimeProfiler()
 profiler.attach(trainer)
 
 trainer.run(list(range(10)), max_epochs=2)
 
 results = profiler.get_results()
 # print(results)
 BasicTimeProfiler.print_results(profiler.get_results());
 
 
 Output:
 
 0.4.0.dev20200206
